org.jetel.component

Class CTLRecordTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.ctl.CTLAbstractTransform
      • org.jetel.component.CTLRecordTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordTransform, Transform

    public abstract class CTLRecordTransform
extends CTLAbstractTransform
implements RecordTransform
    Base class of all Java transforms generated by CTL-to-Java compiler from CTL transforms in Reformat-like and Joiner-like components.
    See Also:
    RecordTransform

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public final boolean init(java.util.Properties parameters,
           DataRecordMetadata[] sourceRecordsMetadata,
           DataRecordMetadata[] targetRecordsMetadata)
                   throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: RecordTransform
        Initializes reformat class/function. This method is called only once at the beginning of transformation process. Any object allocation/initialization should happen here.
        Specified by:
        init in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        parameters - component attributes defined for the component which calls this transformation class
        sourceRecordsMetadata - Metadata describing source data records [array]
        targetRecordsMetadata - Metadata describing target data record
        Returns:
        True if OK, otherwise False
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • initDelegate

        protected java.lang.Boolean initDelegate()
                                  throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Called by init(Properties, DataRecordMetadata[], DataRecordMetadata[]) to perform user-specific initialization defined in the CTL transform. The default implementation does nothing, may be overridden by the generated transform class.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the initialization fails

      • transform

        public final int transform(DataRecord[] sources,
            DataRecord[] targets)
                    throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordTransform
        Performs reformat of source records to target records. This method is called as one step in transforming flow of records.
        For example in simple reformat situation, for one input record, one output record has to be generated. Thus for each incoming record, this method is called by Reformat component.
        The number of source records (sources[]) and target records (target[]) depends on particular component configuration. Can be 1:1 , N:1 or N:M.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        sources - Source DataRecords
        targets - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • transformDelegate

        protected abstract java.lang.Integer transformDelegate()
                                                throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                                                       TransformException
        Called by transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) to transform data records in a user-specific way defined in the CTL transform. Has to be overridden by the generated transform class.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if some internal initialization failed
        TransformException - if an error occurred

      • transformOnError

        public int transformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                   DataRecord[] sources,
                   DataRecord[] targets)
                     throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordTransform
        Performs reformat of source records to target records. This method is called as one step in transforming flow of records.
        For example in simple reformat situation, for one input record, one output record has to be generated. Thus for each incoming record, this method is called by Reformat component.
        The number of source records (sources[]) and target records (target[]) depends on particular component configuration. Can be 1:1 , N:1 or N:M.
        Called only if RecordTransform.transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        transformOnError in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordTransform.transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) to fail
        sources - Source DataRecords
        targets - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • transformOnErrorDelegate

        protected java.lang.Integer transformOnErrorDelegate(java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                         java.lang.String stackTrace)
                                              throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                                                     TransformException
        Called by transformOnError(Exception, DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) to transform data records in a user-specific way defined in the CTL transform. May be overridden by the generated transform class. Throws UnsupportedOperationException by default.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - an error message of the error message that occurred
        stackTrace - a stack trace of the error message that occurred
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if some internal initialization failed
        TransformException - if an error occurred

      • signal

        public final void signal(java.lang.Object signalObject)
        Description copied from interface: RecordTransform
        Method which can be used for signalling into transformation that something outside happened.
        For example in aggregation component key changed.
        Specified by:
        signal in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        signalObject - particular data object - depends on concrete implementation

        getSemiResult in interface RecordTransform
